result.execSummary:
The defendant Juan M Hernandez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: APPLY BAIL. COSTS PAID IN FULL.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt: Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.

Order on Petition for Early Discharge from Probation.
Defendant to be discharged from probation on 5/8/17.
Granted and signed by Judge Aprahamian on May 3, 2017.

From State dated 4/4/17 responding to Court's request; State takes no position.
Reviewed by Judge Aprahamian 4/19/17; Request granted.
To State requesting response by 4/12/17.

From DOC dated 3/22/17 re recommendation of early release of probation.
Reviewed by Judge Aprahamian 3/28/17; Response from state.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Juan M Hernandez in court with attorney Richard E. Poulson.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Amended Information filed. Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1, 3 and 4.  Court finds defendant guilty.

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- 9 months jail straight time concurrent with Cts. 3 and 4 STAYED for 2 years Probation concurrent with Cts. 3 and 4. Court will consider early termination of probation after 18 months if successfully completed
and approved by the agent. 
- Court Costs of $243.00  - apply bail - balance to be paid as condition of probation
- Restitution of  $2787.94 to Home Depot jointly and severally to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
- Conditions of  Probation:  Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling.  No contact with co-defendant or Home Depot.   
- Defendant to perform 100 hours of community service as a condition of Probation

Ct. 3:
- 9 months jail straight time concurrent with Cts. 1 and 4 STAYED for 2 years Probation concurrent with Cts. 1 and 4. Court will consider early termination of probation after 18 months if successfully completed
and approved by the agent. 
- Court Costs of $243.00  - apply bail - balance to be paid as condition of probation
- Conditions of  Probation:  Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling.  No contact with co-defendant or Home Depot.   

Ct. 4:
- 9 months jail straight time concurrent with Cts. 1 and 3 STAYED for 2 years Probation concurrent with Cts. 1 and 3. Court will consider early termination of probation after 18 months if successfully completed
and approved by the agent. 
- Court Costs of $243.00  - apply bail - balance to be paid as condition of probation
- Conditions of  Probation:  Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling.  No contact with co-defendant or Home Depot.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 08-27-2015 09:00 am
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 25, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Juan M Hernandez in court.  Attorney Richard E. Poulson did not appear.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court will set another date for plea/sentencing. If this date is not good for Atty. Poulson, the date may be rescheduled.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 25, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 21, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Juan M Hernandez in court with attorney Richard E. Poulson.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises they are heading towards a plea and requests another date. Court will set this matter for plea/sentencing in 45 days. Defense to advise in advance if this matter will not proceed to plea/sentencing on the next date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Hearing on July 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Juan M Hernandez in court with attorney Richard E. Poulson.  Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests another date. Court will give another date in 3 weeks. Defense to advise on the next date how they will proceed - trial or plea.  Hearing scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Hearing on June 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant Juan M Hernandez in court with attorney Richard E. Poulson.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Arraignment on May 20, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with codefendant/business listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.  Defendant states he posted $1,000.00.

Defendant Juan M Hernandez in court with attorney Gregory Rogaczewski for attorney Richard E. Poulson.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Arraignment scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Cash bail set at $1,000
